newsitem.title: USA: Morgan Stanley restructures global business.
newsitem.headline: Morgan Stanley restructures global business.

text.p: Morgan Stanley Group Inc reorganized its businesses into two main business areas - Securities and Asset Management.
Morgan Stanley, which also made a series of executive changes, said the move reflects the increasingly integrated nature of its global businesses.

Robert Scott, Managing Director and Head of the Investment Banking Division, has been named Chief Financial Officer of Morgan Stanley Group. Joseph Perella will head investment banking and Kenneth Deregt will head fixed income.

Perella, currently Managing Director and Head of Corporate Finance, succeeds Scott as Head of Investment Banking, reporting to Peter Karches. Terry Meguid, Managing Director, will become Head of Corporate Finance.

DeRegt, now a managing director, will report to Peter Karches. Vikram Pandit, Managing Director, will become Head of the Equity Division also reporting to Peter Karches. Neal Garonzik, currently Head of the Equity Division, has decided to retire from Morgan Stanley.
The Securities business will include the Equity, Fixed Income and Investment Banking Divisions.

The Asset Management business will include Morgan Stanley Asset Management, Miller Anderson & Sherrerd, Van Kampen American Capital, Private Client Services, Merchant Banking and Morgan Stanley Services.

The newly integrated Securities business will be headed by Peter Karches, Managing Director and current head of the Fixed Income Division. The combined Asset Management business will be run by James Allwin, Managing Director and current President of Morgan Stanley Asset Management. Both Karches and Allwin will continue to report to John Mack, President of Morgan Stanley Group.
Morgan Stanley has a network of 27 principal offices in 19 countries from which it offers financial services to governments, corporations, institutions and individuals.
